document.title: AppreciateYa ‚Äì Workplace Gratitude App
document.description: AppreciateYa transforms workplace gratitude with easy-to-send kudos, virtual coffees, and gift cards. It promotes a positive culture by celebrating every contribution.

body.raw:
![AppreciateYa Home Page](/img/appreciate/appreciateYa.jpg)
![AI Kudos Generator](/img/appreciate/AI.png)

> AppreciateYa makes saying ‚Äúthank you‚Äù effortless and fun üíå
> Whether it‚Äôs celebrating wins, encouraging peers, or just sending a virtual coffee ‚òï, this app helps teams stay connected and appreciated ‚Äî even when working remotely.

---

## üíª Try the App

- üëâ [Launch AppreciateYa](https://appreciate-ya.vercel.app/)
- üíæ [View Code on GitHub](https://github.com/applescan/appreciate.ya)

---

## üåü Key Features

- üíå **Send Personalized Kudos** ‚Äì Celebrate teammates with gratitude messages, coffee, or gift cards.
- üèÜ **Track Top MVPs** ‚Äì Discover who gives and receives the most appreciation.
- üìä **See Culture Insights** ‚Äì Get a visual pulse on your team‚Äôs appreciation habits.
- ü§ñ **AI Suggestions** ‚Äì Let AI help you write heartfelt notes with just one click!

---

## ‚ú® Why This Matters

In fast-moving workspaces, it's easy to forget to acknowledge one another.
AppreciateYa makes it easy to express gratitude and positivity ‚Äî improving morale, motivation, and human connection across teams.

---

## üß† New Feature: AI Kudos Writer

Too tired to write but want to show you care?
Let the built-in **AI Kudos Generator** write a sweet message on your behalf ‚Äî thoughtful and clever in seconds.

---

## üõ† Built With

- T3 Stack
- Next.js
- Prisma
- Tailwind CSS
- GraphQL
- Supabase
- React
- TypeScript
- Node.js
- Canva & Figma

---

## üé• Product Demo

document.title: [Google Play] Diamond Valley 2024 (KR,TW,JP)
document.description: Diamond Valley 2024 is an enhanced, regionally adapted campaign featuring the engaging 'Diamond Hero' mini-game, fresh graphics, and innovative community features across Korea, Taiwan, and Japan.

body.raw:
![Diamond Valley Japan](/img/diamond-valley/diamond-valley.webp)
![Diamond Valley Pages](/img/diamond-valley/diamond-valley-2.webp)

> Building on its previous success, Diamond Valley 2024 introduces a new mini-game, redesigned characters and layouts, and region-specific features that elevate player engagement across Korea, Taiwan, and Japan. This campaign showcases the power of tailored gamification and community-driven design.

---

## üé• Campaign Showreel

- üíª [View Reel on Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhgduXxqRgM&list=TLGGvUWUXUw3ikEwOTA3MjAyNQ&t=4s)

---

## üåü Key Features

- üéØ **Diamond Hero Mini-Game** ‚Äì New gameplay mode with leaderboard-driven competition and over 1.4 million plays.
- üé® **Remastered Graphics** ‚Äì Updated character designs by Muchang increase appeal and user engagement.
- ü§ù **Community & Multiplayer** ‚Äì Taiwan‚Äôs team challenges, group emojis, and leaderboards boost collaboration and friendly rivalry.
- üì± **Circle to Search** ‚Äì Japan‚Äôs unique interactive quest system, leveraging Android‚Äôs Circle to Search feature for immersive gameplay.
- üéÅ **Sweepstakes System** ‚Äì Flexible auto/manual entry options with gamified UI, resulting in 3.7 million entries and 172,000+ registrations.

---

## üõ† My Role

I was one of the front-end developers responsible for building the website components of Diamond Valley 2024, including the homepage and sweepstakes pages. For the Japan version, I developed the gacha popup feature, enhancing player interaction and excitement.

---

## ‚ú® Evolution & Impact

Originally crafted for Korea in 2023, the campaign was expanded for Taiwan and Japan with custom features tailored to each region‚Äôs audience. The blend of role-play game mechanics, interactive quests, and community-driven rewards powered a 2.7x increase in registrations and heightened player engagement across markets.

---

## üõ† Built With

- Angular 19
- Pixi.js
- TypeScript
- CSS3
- HTML5
- Node.js
- Google Play API integrations

---

## üé• Campaign Showreel

<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source src="/img/diamond-valley/dv-1.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source src="/img/diamond-valley/dv-2.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source src="/img/diamond-valley/dv-3.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source src="/img/diamond-valley/dv-4.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

---

## ü§ù Collaboration & Sponsorships

Partnerships with Muchang, Google, and sponsors like Honkai: Star Rail, Solo Leveling, Genshin Impact, and Le Sserafim brought exciting brand integrations into the gameplay, elevating the experience for players and fans alike.

---

> Diamond Valley 2024 demonstrates how creative regional adaptations and gamified experiences can drive meaningful engagement in diverse markets.

document.title: Hikitia Air ‚Äì Airline Booking UI & UX Case Study
document.description: Hikitia Air is a UX case study from my UX Design Institute program. It explores how to improve the online airline booking process through user research, testing, and prototyping. The project prioritizes clarity, simplicity, and efficiency.

body.raw:
![Banner 1](/img/hikitia/banner1.jpg)
![Banner 2](/img/hikitia/banner2.jpg)
![Banner 3](/img/hikitia/banner3.jpg)

> ‚úàÔ∏è During my studies at The UX Design Institute, I conducted a full UX case study for a fictional airline called Hikitia Air. My goal was to improve the digital airline booking experience ‚Äî streamlining it to be fast, intuitive, and genuinely helpful to users. From research to prototype, I took on every role in the UX process.

---

## üîç Competitive Benchmark

Before jumping into design, I studied top airline booking platforms to understand what they‚Äôre doing right (or wrong). Key questions I explored:

- What UX patterns are working well and worth adopting?
- What pain points keep recurring across platforms?
- What standards should I incorporate into my own flow?

![Competitive Benchmark](/img/hikitia/competitiveBenchmark.jpg)

üëâ [Download the full research](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1O41oy2mXxg4WHdttVp4EIWDrc8L7RDEu/view?usp=sharing)

---

## üß™ Usability Testing

I ran usability tests on real airline websites to capture user behaviors, habits, and frustrations. A few takeaways:

- Users browse flights on mobile but prefer booking on desktop.
- Incomplete or scattered info causes user hesitation.
- Fare breakdowns were often unclear or misleading.

![Usability Testing](/img/hikitia/usabilityTesting.jpg)

---

## üß† Affinity Diagram

Once research was gathered, I organized insights into themes using an affinity diagram. This helped synthesize findings and identify clear priorities for design.

- Observations from benchmarks, surveys, and tests were written on sticky notes.
- Grouped into thematic clusters in Miro.
- These categories informed both the Customer Journey and User Flow.

![Affinity Diagram](/img/hikitia/affinityDiagram.jpg)

üëâ [Download the affinity diagram](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bxbu8jYEQaOKrNkOtWUaDKARAWF5SweO/view?usp=sharing)

---

## üß≠ Customer Journey Map

I created a detailed journey map to visualize the user experience from start to finish. This made it easier to spot friction points and opportunities for improvement.

![Customer Journey](/img/hikitia/customerJourney.jpg)

---

## üß© User Flow

The user flow mapped out the ideal booking process and ensured every UX decision was based on real user insights.

- Covers the high-level steps in booking a flight
- Solves pain points identified in the journey map
- Prepares the foundation for wireframes and prototypes

![User Flow](/img/hikitia/userFlow.jpg)

üëâ [Download the user flow](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hWYWnPCmVyw9EZXdwIdv7S0LjrWvxfky/view?usp=sharing)

---

## ‚ú® High-Fidelity Prototype (Annotated)

I designed a high-fidelity prototype in Figma, integrating all research insights into one polished interface. It‚Äôs designed to be clean, efficient, and user-first.

![Prototype 1](/img/hikitia/anno1.jpg)
![Prototype 2](/img/hikitia/anno2.jpg)

üëâ [Download the prototype](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WQujyCpGtKgX9nqwViM1nZnIBNMxWmZu/view?usp=sharing)

---

## üß™ Try the Prototype

üëâ [View Interactive Prototype on Figma](https://www.figma.com/proto/kYbZQzyFiQLNmRcuyHwCK0/FeliciaFelicia_Project11?type=design&t=8QoeQDWaLhHxv6pM-1&scaling=scale-down&page-id=0%3A1&node-id=120-117&starting-point-node-id=120%3A117)

---

## üéØ Results

This project was a comprehensive deep dive into UX design ‚Äî from raw research to an interactive, high-fidelity prototype. It taught me how to ask the right questions, design for real users, and build experiences that are both delightful and efficient.

document.title: Mi Casa - Virtual House Tour
document.description: Mi Casa is a fun, interactive virtual tour of my house! Explore the different rooms, and get to know more about me. The game introduces a blend of exploration, storytelling, and mini-games to keep you entertained.

body.raw:
![Welcome to my living room!](/img/mi-casa/1.png)
![Meet the characters!](/img/mi-casa/2.png)

> Mi Casa is a fun, casual way to explore a world that feels like home. It's all about creating a playful, personalized space where you can wander and enjoy mini-games designed to make you smile. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a fun escape or a chance to learn more about me through the game‚Äôs playful settings, Mi Casa is here to make your day just a little brighter! üåü

---

## üéÆ Try the Game

- üëâ [Play Mi Casa](https://mi-casa-xi.vercel.app/)
- üíª [View Code on GitHub](https://github.com/applescan/mi-casa)

---

## üåü Key Features

- üè° **Explore My Virtual Home** ‚Äì Wander through cozy rooms filled with personality!
- üòÅ **Meet Adorable Characters** ‚Äì Enjoy fun, quirky interactions!
- üéÆ **Unlock Mini-Games** ‚Äì Solve puzzles, collect rewards, and have fun!
- ü•≥ **Charm & Surprise** ‚Äì Chill, laugh, and discover hidden details throughout!

---

## ‚ú® Bonus Surprise!

This is just the beginning! Expect **more mini-games** and character interactions in future updates. Stay tuned!

---

## üõ† Built With

- React
- Kaboom.js
- TypeScript
- CSS3
- HTML5
- WebGL
- Figma
- Node.js

---

## üé• Gameplay Video

<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source
    src="/img/mi-casa/mi-casa.mp4"
    type="video/mp4"
    poster="/img/mi-casa/1.png"
  />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

document.title: Mixtape-me | Spotify App Integration
document.description: Throwback to the 90s! Mixtape-me lets you log into Spotify and generate a retro-styled mixtape of your top 5 most-played tracks ‚Äî then download and share it.

body.raw:
![Mixtape cover preview](/img/mixtape/demo1.jpg)
![User mixtape UI](/img/mixtape/demo2.jpg)

> üé∂ Mixtape-me is a nostalgic twist on modern music streaming. Inspired by the days of physical CD shops and handmade playlists, this app revives the joy of curating and sharing your favorite tracks ‚Äî but with Spotify's real-time data magic.

---

## üöÄ Try It Out

- üéß [Try the App](https://mixtape-me.herokuapp.com/)
- üíª [View Code on GitHub](https://github.com/applescan/Mixtape-me)

---

## üîê Requirements

Mixtape-me uses the Spotify Web API. To generate your mixtape:

- You must **log in with Spotify** and authorize the app
- Mixtape-me does **not store** or collect any user data
- It fetches your top 5 most-played tracks and visualizes them ‚Äî that's it!

---

## üõ† Built With

- HTML / CSS / JavaScript
- Bootstrap
- Spotify Web API
- Heroku
- GitHub
- Figma
- Visual Studio Code

---

## üó∫Ô∏è User Guide

- Log in with your Spotify account
- Choose between top songs from:
  - The past month
  - Last 6 months
  - The past year
- View and download your custom mixtape as an image
- Share it with your friends!

---

## üß† How It Works

Mixtape-me taps into **Spotify‚Äôs Web API** to access your listening history. Once authorized:

- It pulls your top 5 most-played tracks
- Creates a **retro mixtape-style UI** using your song titles, artist names, and cover art
- You can then **download the mixtape image** or take a screenshot for sharing

---

## üß™ Troubleshooting

**Q: The image won‚Äôt download.**
A: Try a different browser or take a screenshot instead.

**Q: The app isn‚Äôt working.**
A: Clear cookies or site data for `mixtape-me.herokuapp.com`, or try again on a new device.

---

## üìö Spotify Developer Dashboard

The project is powered by **Spotify‚Äôs official Web API**. Here‚Äôs what I did:

- Registered my app on the Spotify Developer Console
- Explored available endpoints for tracks, users, and listening history
- Fetched data in **JSON format** following RESTful principles
- Used that data to design and render mixtape layouts in the app

---

![Spotify stats dashboard](/img/mixtape/stats.jpg)

---

## üìä Launch Results

Mixtape-me was met with **early user excitement**!
Many users enjoyed generating and sharing their nostalgic playlists.

> üéØ My personal goal: **100 mixtapes shared** ‚Äî and counting!
> User feedback helped refine the UI and highlight unexpected use cases.

---

## üìé App Access

> Try it here ‚Üí [https://mixtape-me.herokuapp.com/](https://mixtape-me.herokuapp.com/)

document.title: NZ Veterinary Locum Network
document.description: A web platform built to connect veterinary locums and clinics in New Zealand ‚Äî replacing outdated Facebook groups and removing the need for third-party recruiters.

body.raw:
![Desktop UI](/img/locum/nz-locum1.jpg)
![Mobile Mockup](/img/locum/nz-locum2.jpg)

> The **NZ Veterinary Locum Network** was created to solve a real communication gap in the veterinary industry.
> Locums in NZ had no proper way to showcase their profiles ‚Äî and clinics had no central platform to find available locums.
> This project creates that missing link and gives both sides the ability to connect freely and directly.

---

## üñ• Try It Out

- üëâ [Visit the App](https://nz-locum-network.netlify.app/)
- üíª [Front-end Code](https://github.com/applescan/NZ-Locum-Frontend)
- üîß [Back-end Code](https://github.com/applescan/NZ-Veterinary-Locum-CapstoneProject)

---

## üí° Why Is This Project Important?

There was **no platform** tailored for veterinary locums in NZ to promote themselves outside of recruitment agencies.
New locums who lack clinic connections find it nearly impossible to discover job opportunities.

The **only option** before was a cluttered Facebook group.
This app changes that ‚Äî offering clinics a searchable, organized way to find and message locums directly.

---

## üéØ Project Goals

- Create a **central hub** for veterinary job listings and locum profiles
- Help **clinics and doctors connect** without third-party involvement
- Replace the reliance on Facebook groups with a **professional platform**

---

## üõ† Built With

- Axios
- Bcryptjs
- Express.js
- MongoDB + MongoDB Atlas
- Multer
- Node.js
- Swagger UI
- MDB Bootstrap
- MUI
- React
- Bootstrap / CSS
- Canva + Figma

---

## üë©‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è User Guide (Doctor)

- Register an account as a **doctor**
- Sign in using your credentials
- You'll be redirected to your profile upon login
- You can:
  - Edit or delete your profile
  - Browse **clinics, jobs, and other doctors**

---

## üè• User Guide (Clinic)

- Register an account as a **clinic**
- Sign in using your credentials
- You'll be redirected to your profile upon login
- You can:
  - Edit or delete your clinic profile
  - Add, edit, or delete **job listings**
  - Browse **other clinics, doctors, and jobs**

---

## üêõ Known Limitation

> ‚ùó If you upload an image over **1MB**, it may fail due to outdated TLS policies on the cloud server.
> Modern browsers block these uploads due to CORS errors.

You can read more about it [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/network/create-tls-listener.html).

> ‚úÖ If you run the backend **locally**, this issue should not occur.

---

## üîÆ Future Enhancement

I plan to add **automatic expiration for job listings**.
Once the due date has passed, listings will be hidden or deleted automatically ‚Äî helping keep the platform clean and up to date.

---

## üì± App Access

> Try it here ‚Üí [https://nz-locum-network.netlify.app/](https://nz-locum-network.netlify.app/)

document.title: Sarana Dashboard & Point of Sales System
document.description: A custom POS and dashboard built to streamline sales, stock, and order management for my family's shop in Indonesia. Sarana is designed with simplicity, bilingual support, and real-time insights.

body.raw:
![Sarana dashboard overview](/img/sarana/1.webp)
![Point of Sales screen](/img/sarana/2.webp)

> Sarana Point of Sales System is a user-friendly POS solution designed to simplify sales and inventory management for small businesses.
> I built this to help manage my family's store, offering an intuitive bilingual interface, real-time stock control, and AI-enhanced insights tailored to their needs.

---

## üöÄ Try the App

- üëâ [Visit the App](https://sarana-dashboard.vercel.app/)
- üíª [View Code on GitHub](https://github.com/applescan/Sarana-Dashboard)

---

## üß† Why This Project?

Managing small businesses shouldn't require complex tools.
The previous POS setup was difficult to use, slow, and cluttered. Sarana was created to solve that ‚Äî with clean workflows and only the features my parents actually need.

---

## ü™Ñ Unique Touches

- üáÆüá© **Bilingual Interface** (Indonesian & English)
- üéØ Custom features tuned to my family's actual workflows
- üîÑ Simplified experience that doesn't overwhelm

---

## üîê Key Features

### üìä Dashboard

- **Real-Time Insights**: Monitor sales, stock, and revenue instantly üîç
- **AI-Powered Trends**: Built-in OpenAI support for smarter decisions ü§ñ

### üì¶ Product Management

- Powerful **search & filter** tools üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
- Instant **stock tracking** üì¶
- Easy **admin editing** ‚úèÔ∏è

### üìÉ Order Management

- Browse by date or keyword üìÖ
- Modify orders without friction üßë‚Äçüíº
- **Mark as Received** to auto-update stock ‚úÖ

---

## ‚ú® Bonus!

This version uses a test database ‚Äî so if you see a 404, it's likely the free Supabase tier limit was reached üòÖ
Still, feel free to explore and let me know what you think!

---

## üõ† Built With

- Next.js
- Prisma
- Clerk (Auth)
- Tailwind CSS + ShadCN
- GraphQL + Apollo
- OpenAI (AI Insights)
- Supabase (DB)
- Echarts
- TypeScript
- Canva / Figma

---

## üé• App Demo

<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source
    src="/img/sarana/sarana.mp4"
    type="video/mp4"
    poster="/img/sarana/1.webp"
  />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

document.title: [Google Play] Diamond Castle ‚Äì Tokyo Game Show 2024
document.description: A fast-paced mini-game and interactive event site created to celebrate Google Play Japan‚Äôs presence at the 2024 Tokyo Game Show. Designed for both in-person and online audiences, Diamond Castle brought the excitement of TGS directly to players' screens.

body.raw:
![Diamond Castle Gameplay](/img/tgs/tgs-1.webp)
![Retro-inspired UI Design](/img/tgs/tgs-2.webp)

> Created for the 2024 Tokyo Game Show, **Diamond Castle** is a vertical speed runner and mobile-friendly mini-game developed in collaboration with Google Play Japan. It blends retro flair, modern branding, and event-based interaction into a vibrant online experience.

---

## üé• Campaign Showreel

- üíª [View Reel on Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w1Huo7F7S4I&list=TLGGfN2m5Wtxa9swOTA3MjAyNQ)

---

## üåü Key Highlights

- üè∞ **Original Mini-Game** ‚Äì A vertical climber game with smooth mobile controls and high replay value.
- üì± **Online + On-Site** ‚Äì Built to extend the Tokyo Game Show experience beyond the exhibit hall.
- üéÅ **Reward System** ‚Äì Leaderboard ranks, social sharing, and early sign-ups unlocked exclusive giveaways.
- ü§ù **Cross-Studio Collaboration** ‚Äì Designed in partnership with Kayac and Hakuhodo for Google Play Japan.
- üéÆ **Game Dev Collabs** ‚Äì Integrated content from top developers like HoYoverse and Bandai Namco.

---

## üõ† My Role

As a frontend developer on the team, I helped build the website interface and ensure a seamless experience across devices. This included implementing the homepage layout, optimizing the game‚Äôs mobile performance, and collaborating closely with designers to bring the vibrant retro look to life.

---

## üîß The Process

- üß≠ **User Flow & Wireframing** ‚Äì Established clear content structure and intuitive player journey from landing to game.
- üß± **Asset Refinement** ‚Äì Ensured pixel-perfect placement of characters, objects, and collision zones.
- üé® **Visual Balance** ‚Äì Merged Google Play‚Äôs bold identity with Diamond Castle‚Äôs playful, nostalgic style.
- üß© **Iterative Collaboration** ‚Äì Worked side-by-side with Japanese designers and developers to align gameplay feel with real-world event excitement.

---

## üß† Designed For

- Tokyo Game Show 2024
- VIP Event Attendees
- Casual mobile gamers
- Game community on social platforms (X, LINE, etc.)

---

## üõ† Built With

- Angular
- TypeScript
- Pixi.js
- CSS3 + HTML5
- Node.js
- Game analytics tools

---

## üé• Campaign Showreel

<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source src="/img/tgs/carousel1.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
<video controls width="100%" preload="auto">
  <source src="/img/tgs/carousel2.mp4" type="video/mp4" />
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

---

> Diamond Castle brought the energy of Tokyo Game Show to life online ‚Äî letting players everywhere climb, compete, and celebrate the joy of gaming. üéÆ‚ú®

document.title: What to Eat - A Recipe Recommendation Engine üå≠ü•´
document.description: What to Eat is a recipe recommendation engine that suggests recipes based on your dietary preferences and ingredients on hand ‚Äî helping reduce food waste and make meal planning easier.

body.raw:
![Recipe Generator UI](/img/what-to-eat/What-to-eat-1.png)
![Mockup Screen](/img/what-to-eat/What-to-eat-2.png)

> What to Eat takes the guesswork out of meal planning. Whether you're working with limited ingredients or specific dietary needs, this app helps you discover recipes that fit your lifestyle. üçΩÔ∏è
> It's also a step toward reducing food waste by helping you use what you already have at home. üåç

---

## üç¥ Try the App

- üëâ [Visit the App](https://what-to-eat-2.vercel.app/)
- üíª [View Code on GitHub](https://github.com/applescan/what-to-eat-2)
- üöÄ [Featured on Product Hunt](https://www.producthunt.com/products/what-to-eat-2)

---

## üí° Why This Project?

This started as a fun side project to explore **TypeScript** and **Next.js**.
It‚Äôs grown into a tool I actually use when I don‚Äôt know what to cook. ü§ì

---

## üéØ Goals

- ‚úÖ Help users **reduce food waste**
- ‚úÖ Make meal planning easier
- ‚úÖ Inspire people to **cook more at home**
- ‚úÖ Empower users with dietary restrictions

---

## üßë‚Äçüç≥ How to Use

1. Click **"Get Recipe"** on the homepage
2. Choose your dietary preferences
3. Enter ingredients you have
4. Hit **Next** to get personalized recipe ideas
5. Click on a recipe to view details

---

## üêõ Known Limitations

- Typos in ingredients may cause search failures ‚Äî user input must be precise
- Occasionally, the Spoonacular API may return ingredients outside selected dietary filters

---

## üöÄ Future Enhancements

- Integrate **NLP** to auto-correct input typos in the ingredient form
- Add **meal planning** features
- Let users **save favorite recipes** for future access

---

## üõ† Built With

- T3 Stack
- React
- TypeScript
- Next.js
- Prisma
- Tailwind CSS
- tRPC
- NextAuth.js
- Spoonacular API
- Canva / Figma

---

## üì± Live App

> Explore recipe at
> üëâ [https://what-to-eat-2.vercel.app/](https://what-to-eat-2.vercel.app/)

document.title: Whazup ‚Äî NZ Event Discovery App
document.description: Whazup is a modern, swipe-style event discovery app for New Zealand that recommends personalised events using the Eventfinda API.

body.raw:
![Whazup UI 1](/img/Whazup/Whazup.png)
![Whazup UI 2](/img/Whazup/Whazup-2.png)

> Whazup helps you find events around New Zealand with a quick, fun, swipe-based questionnaire ‚Äî making event discovery personal and effortless. üåü
> Built to surface concerts, workshops, festivals and more without sifting through long lists.

---

## üëâ Try Whazup

- üëâ **Live app:** https://Whazup.vercel.app/
- üíª **Source code:** https://github.com/applescan/Whazup

---

## üí° Why this project?

Whazup was created to combine simple, mobile-first UX with rich local event data so users can quickly discover things to do. The app uses a Tinder-style swipe onboarding to match interests to events and relies on the Eventfinda API for location + event data.

---

## üéØ Goals

-  Provide **personalised event recommendations** based on user interests
-  Offer **localised event discovery** across New Zealand
-  Deliver **fast, mobile-first UI/UX** with a swipe-style questionnaire
-  Cover diverse event categories (music, theatre, sports, festivals, workshops)

---

## üß≠ User Flow

1. Welcome ‚Äî choose a region or allow automatic location suggestions.
2. Swipe interface ‚Äî go through curated questions to indicate your tastes.
3. Matching ‚Äî the app analyses preferences and matches event categories.
4. Results ‚Äî celebratory match + curated events list.
5. Event details ‚Äî book through Eventfinda links when available.

---

## üìö Event Categories

Whazup covers eight major categories:
1. Concerts & Gig Guide
2. Performing Arts
3. Theatre
4. Sports & Outdoors
5. Festivals & Lifestyle
6. Dance
7. Exhibitions
8. Workshops & Classes.

---

## üõ† Built With

- **Next.js 14** (App Router)
- **TypeScript**
- **Tailwind CSS**
- **Framer Motion** (animations & gestures)
- **Lucide React** (icons)
- **Eventfinda API** (events & locations)
- Next.js API Routes, SSR, image optimisation & caching.

---

## üöÄ Features

- Tinder-style swipe questionnaire for interest matching.
- 180+ questions created across the app (curated set for onboarding).
- Location-based filtering & region grouping across New Zealand.
- Glassmorphism UI, animated backgrounds, responsive layout, and PWA-friendly touches.

---
